intro: [WRONG START] Gunniosis zygophylloides, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow floral spikes. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. The golden wattle is also the national floral emblem of Australia, symbolizing the country's natural beauty.
